column1: Tres Arroyos is a city in Buenos Aires Province
column2: Argentina. It is the administrative seat of Tres Arroyos Partido.

column1: The city has a sizable population of Danish and Dutch descent.
Tres Arroyos is served by Tres Arroyos Airport.
Roughly 5 km from the city of Tres Arroyos lies the "Arroyo Seco" archaeological site
column2: which is considered to be one of the oldest yet found in Argentina. Over 40 skeletons
column5: dated to estimated age of 9000 years B.P. The site includes tools
column6: hunting implements and fossils of extinct mammals. Much of the extensive materials are on display at the José A. Mulazzi Municipal Museum
column7: which includes reconstructions of how the people of the time lived..

column1: The city is home to Huracán de Tres Arroyos
column2: a football team playing in the regional leagues
column3: but who played in the Argentine Primera as recently as 2004-05.

column1: Municipal information: Municipal Affairs Federal Institute (IFAM)
